body: Can you give some details on your dataset and if this is training from scratch or finetuning? Maybe the config you use as well. The figures show that there's been no learning.
I am not sure what is wrong, I could not replicate the problem with my own PWGAN training.

@erogol @george-roussos  

After setting the `stats_path` into `null`, the results is below. It seems that the learning processing is quite slow. The model could not learn the melspec well. The Eval melspec figure is quite blurred.

![Screenshot 2020-09-09 at 3 52 37 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11624203/92570659-bef53f00-f2b4-11ea-8f92-9785bad67b45.png)


![Screenshot 2020-09-09 at 3 52 21 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11624203/92570646-bac92180-f2b4-11ea-9b2a-5bbdff0ede8f.png)
That's weird. What can you tell us about the dataset? Do you have any samples of it?
@george-roussos that's an Indonesia datasets. I could provide few samples. Thanks for helping. I am not sure whether the weird results come from the `AUDIO PARAMETERS` setting in config files.
@george-roussos thanks George. So you mean whatever add `stats_path` or not, would not affect huge effect on the result, at least would not generate weird result ?

The sound is very good, so there is something else that is wrong. Are all files 22050 mono?

The stats file is about normalization relative to the dataset values. So if you do not use it, it should still be fine. You can try the config I pasted.
@george-roussos really thanks George. Yes, all files are 22050 mono. I will try as you said. And will let you know the results as soon as possible.
It is, yes. It will change when the discriminator kicks in. Looks much healthier now. Hope it works better.
@george-roussos Really thanks George. I will keep you update.
